title: How to Make a Cake Roll and Pudding Dessert

steps.headline: Take a small bowl,  dump both bottles of whipped cream into it.
Whisk the whipped cream until it bubbles up.
Cut the cake rolls and put them into another bowl.
Put the first layer of whipped cream and then a layer of cake rolls.
Keep doing it  until your cake and cream are over.
steps.description:
The topmost layer must always be the cream! {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/29\/Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/2\/29\/Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid3667116-v4-728px-Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":334,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"529","licensing":"

steps.headline: Break your bars of chocolate into triangles, cut if required.
steps.description: If you are using  strawberries, you may cut them into half, or wash them or remove the stalks and hulls.

steps.headline: Put the decorative chocolate and/or strawberries on the cake and cream.
Keep it in  the fridge for 5 hours.
Done!
steps.description: Now you can chop and eat!

text:
Take a small bowl, dump both bottles of whipped cream into it. Whisk the whipped cream until it bubbles up. Cut the cake rolls and put them into another bowl. Put the first layer of whipped cream and then a layer of cake rolls. (finish the layer of cake) Keep doing it until your cake and cream are over. The topmost layer must always be the cream! {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/2/29/Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/aid3667116-v4-728px-Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":334,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"529","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Break your bars of chocolate into triangles, cut if required. If you are using strawberries, you may cut them into half, or wash them or remove the stalks and hulls. Put the decorative chocolate and/or strawberries on the cake and cream. Put the chocolates in a vertical direction. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/7/70/Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/aid3667116-v4-728px-Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":334,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"529","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Put the strawberries in a horizontal direction. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a7/Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/a/a7/Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/aid3667116-v4-728px-Make-a-Tasty-Cake-Pudding-Easily-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":334,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"529","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Keep it in the fridge for 5 hours. Done! Now you can chop and eat!
